Here are some interesting polygons to try out the unfolding algorithm on. All of them were generated by first creating a random point cloud with respect to various distributions and then producing an alpha shape of the cloud.

Polygons are given as lists of vertices - the last vertex is repeated, since the polygons are closed. Simply remove the last vertex to make an arc.

Polygons generated using a uniform distribution:

[(0.004290940463553383, 0.811174022220635), (0.02921398044144763, 0.8787593832250118), (0.004517702601637308, 0.9776169585506858), (0.18600598914836386, 0.9899514362818096), (0.22689691603752882, 0.9400860384451739), (0.37212044208118944, 0.8969448801052792), (0.5300667751676886, 0.9287900146410544), (0.5778372141596275, 0.9726494293965833), (0.5861008260381689, 0.9837263112151959), (0.6518957656530512, 0.9966267351247031), (0.583343120058406, 0.9618672427463438), (0.6742928196381288, 0.78570892192822), (0.7027417195042281, 0.7289441397875523), (0.8374758358851503, 0.5866690692573445), (0.9518441864207796, 0.6648284774058111), (0.9678673840082316, 0.5701385038317429), (0.9718057175544085, 0.44485416687236123), (0.9282996365491853, 0.29348807045540315), (0.9442799870486372, 0.22169028415842706), (0.9780911510136211, 0.050377955109129346), (0.8574738825451107, 0.07952420302628727), (0.7616795273720293, 0.06844244127979637), (0.7218267759296405, 0.019228991889132963), (0.7001644630107065, 0.16127033276233615), (0.6470832999353038, 0.2062022828548754), (0.5812388597916682, 0.2796020234160064), (0.4237064791142864, 0.17124811973578102), (0.4454313298198367, 0.09568237797807044), (0.2753590595281902, 0.10982174688281388), (0.3567468418449581, 0.2691680694416141), (0.31358447938456013, 0.42179559550408474), (0.17755244475791343, 0.44106441078557024), (0.14342560097307822, 0.3196651024868017), (0.10513931104362928, 0.4587804328093693), (0.08393234603410327, 0.5644561016787456), (0.07252022274331171, 0.5849934757859409), (0.0061291914426326866, 0.6495079828821837), (0.1567277080825148, 0.6666628211788195), (0.17999562574667682, 0.778326703006977), (0.004290940463553383, 0.811174022220635)]
